Title:
Morphological and rDNA-based phylogenetic identification of a
new species in Perenniporia (Basidiomycota)
Abstract:
Perenniporia nonggangensis is described and illustrated
based on morphological and molecular characteristics from Guangxi
Autonomous Region of southern China. The new species is individualized
by an annual growth habit, resupinate basidiocarps with snow white to
cream pore surface, context white to cream when fresh, up to 1.4 cm
thick, tissue turns into dark brown color in 5% potassium hydroxide
(KOH); cystidioles are fusoid; dimitic hyphal system, with dextrinoid
and cyanophilous skeleto-binding hyphae; basidiospores (3.1â4.4 Ã
2.7â3.6 Âµm) hyaline, thick-walled, IKIâ, and weakly cyanophilous. Both
morphological and molecular documentation confirmed that this new
species belongs to the genus Perenniporia and closely related to other
species of this genus.
